This set of nuclides is also known as the line of beta stability, a term already in common use in 1965.  This line lies along the bottom of the nuclear valley of stability.
summary: The line of beta stability is related to the nuclear valley of stability in that it represents the energy levels at which beta decay occurs, which is a type of radioactive decay. The nuclear valley of stability is a graphical representation of the most stable nuclei, with the line of beta stability being the energy level at which beta decay is most likely to occur.

body:
The 1965 NFL Championship Game was the 33rd championship game for the National Football League (NFL), played on January 2, 1966, at Lambeau Field in Green Bay, Wisconsin. This was the first NFL championship game played in January, as well as the first televised in color and the last played prior to the Super Bowl era. It would be staged four more times as a qualifier for the Super Bowl before being replaced with the NFC championship game post-merger.
The game matched the Eastern Conference champion Cleveland Browns (113), the defending NFL champions, and the Green Bay Packers (1031) of the Western Conference. A week earlier, the Packers defeated the Baltimore Colts in a tiebreaker Western Conference playoff at Lambeau Field, while the Browns were idle. The Packers were making their first appearance in the championship game in three years, since their consecutive wins in 1961 and 1962. Green Bay was relegated to the third place Playoff Bowl the previous two seasons, with a victory over the Browns and a loss to the St. Louis Cardinals.
The home field for the NFL title game alternated between the conferences; in odd-numbered seasons, the Western team was the host. Home field advantage was not implemented in the NFL playoffs until 1975.
With the 2312 victory, the Packers won their ninth NFL title, sixth in the championship game era.
summary: Cleveland Browns and Green Bay Packers.

It is located on the right bank of the Vistula River, between the Vistula and the Ryn River, and is surrounded by forests and fields. Kazu Nowy is situated in a region known for its agriculture, forestry, and mining industries. It is also home to several small villages and towns, including Kazu, Zabocie, and Krzywoszyn.

Lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) people in Senegal experience legal persecution. Senegal specifically outlaws same-sex sexual acts and, in the past, has prosecuted men accused of homosexuality. Members of the LGBTQ community face routine discrimination in Senegalese society.
According to the 2013 Pew Global Attitudes Project, 97 of Senegal residents believe that homosexuality is a way of life that society should not accept, a figure unchanged from 2007.
summary: It remained unchanged.

body:
Lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) people in Senegal experience legal persecution. Senegal specifically outlaws same-sex sexual acts and, in the past, has prosecuted men accused of homosexuality. Members of the LGBTQ community face routine discrimination in Senegalese society.
According to the 2013 Pew Global Attitudes Project, 97 of Senegal residents believe that homosexuality is a way of life that society should not accept, a figure unchanged from 2007.
summary: The Pew Global Attitudes Project surveyed public opinion in Senegal between 2007 and 2013. According to the survey, the percentage of people who strongly or somewhat agreed with the statement "Laws protecting homosexuality are necessary to prevent discrimination and protect the rights of gays" increased from 20 in 2007 to 45 in 2013. This suggests that public opinion in Senegal had become more accepting of homosexuality between 2007 and 2013. However, this trend is not consistent across all regions or demographics. For example, in 2007, 32 of men and 31 of women in rural areas agreed with this statement, while in 2013, these numbers decreased to 28 and 25, respectively.

body: Sir Alan Graham Dawtry  (8 April 1915  27 January 2018) was a British municipal government official. He was an Assistant solicitor at Sheffield City Council between 1938 and 1948, deputy town clerk at Bolton, England between 1948-1952 and Leicester, England between 1952-1954 and town clerk Wolverhampton, England, 19541956. He was Chief Executive of the Westminster City Council between 1956 and 1977. During his career, he was also Town Clerk for the City of Westminster. In the 1974 New Year Honours, Dawtry was knighted.
summary: Alan Graham Dawtry served as the deputy town clerk in Leicester, England between 1952 and 1954.

body:
Dichomeris squalens is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Edward Meyrick in 1914. It is found in Guyana and Brazil.
The wingspan is 1213 mm (0.470.51 in). The forewings are greyish ochreous or pale fuscous, sprinkled with darker fuscous. The markings are rather dark brown, consisting of a small spot on the fold at one-fourth, the stigmata moderate, the plical rather obliquely before the first discal. There is an additional dot more or less marked before and above the first discal and there is an irregular indistinct paler line from three-fourths of the costa to the dorsum before the tornus, somewhat curved outwards and indented above the middle, edged with brown suffusion posteriorly. There is also a series of blackish dots around the posterior part of the costa and termen. The hindwings are grey.


== References ==
summary: Guyana and Brazil

body:
Euphorbia duranii is a species of plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is endemic to Madagascar.  It is threatened by habitat loss.


== References ==
summary: Euphorbia duranii, being endemic to Madagascar, highlights the island's unique biodiversity and ecological significance. Endemism indicates that species evolve in isolation and may have specific roles within their ecosystems. The presence of such species is indicative of healthy ecosystems and contributes to the overall ecological balance. However, endemic species are often more vulnerable to extinction, especially under threats like habitat loss. The loss of Euphorbia duranii could have cascading effects on its ecosystem, potentially affecting other species that rely on it for habitat or as part of the food web. Therefore, understanding and preserving the ecological niches of endemic species like Euphorbia duranii is crucial for maintaining biodiversity and ecological integrity in Madagascar.

body:
Euphorbia duranii is a species of plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is endemic to Madagascar.  It is threatened by habitat loss.


== References ==
summary: Classifying Euphorbia duranii as endemic to Madagascar could have implications for biodiversity and ecological balance. This species is known for its wide range of ecological adaptations, including the ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen through the production of enzymes. As a result, the removal of this species from Madagascar could have negative consequences for the local ecosystem, potentially leading to a decrease in nitrogen fixation and a decline in plant species diversity. This could in turn affect local communities that rely on these resources for their livelihoods. Therefore, it is important to consider the potential ecological and socioeconomic implications before making any decisions regarding the classification of this species.

body:
Wem railway station serves the town of Wem in Shropshire, England. The station is 10 miles (17 km) north of Shrewsbury on the Welsh Marches Line to Crewe.
The station has two platforms. There is a level crossing at the north end of the station. This is now the only way for passengers to cross the line at the station, since the station footbridge was taken down. The level crossing is where Aston Street becomes Aston Road.
Over the weekend of 89 August 2015 the signal box which was located next to the level crossing was demolished. The barriers have been controlled remotely from the South Wales ROC at Cardiff since 2013 and the signal box was deemed obsolete.
There is also a small car park, which is accessed from Aston Street.
The signal box's Network Rail designation was "WM".
summary: 10 miles (17 km) north of Shrewsbury.

summary: Wem railway station is located in the town of Wem in the county of Shropshire, England. It is approximately 10 miles (16 km) from the town of Shrewsbury.

body:
Terpsion (Greek: , gen.: ; fl. 5th4th century BCE) of Megara is a speaker in Plato's dialogues. 
In the frame story which serves as the prologue to Plato's Theaetetus, Terpsion asks his friend Euclid of Megara to recount the dialogue between Socrates and Theaetetus. Terpsion also appears in the Phaedo as one of the people who was present at the death of Socrates. Debra Nails states that nothing else reliable can be determined about Terpsion, and all later sources that mention him, such as Plutarch and the pseudonymous Socratic letters, are derived from the account in Plato's dialogues.
summary: Debra Nails notes that there is very little reliable information available about Terpsion aside from his mentions in Plato's dialogues. According to her, all later references to Terpsion in the works of authors such as Plutarch and in the pseudonymous Socratic letters originate from Plato's accounts. This suggests that the historical validity of Terpsion's life, character, and contributions is limited, as later sources do not provide independent verification or substantial additional detail about him. Essentially, Terpsion's legacy in historical philosophical discourse heavily relies on the narrative constructed by Plato, indicating that most of what we know of him originates from these specific contexts and is not supported by separate historical accounts.

summary: Drunk History holds a significant place in Derek Waters' career as it is a television series that he is best known for. Waters not only starred in the series but was also instrumental in its creation as a producer and director. body: Raj Nartaki is a 1941 Indian Hindi-language drama film directed by Modhu Bose under the Wadia Movietone banner. It starred the famous dancer Sadhana Bose (written as Sadhona in the title) with Prithviraj Kapoor, Jal Khambata, Nayampalli and Protima Das Gupta. It was made simultaneously in English, Bengali and Hindi. The film was distributed in Europe and US through Columbia in Hollywood. It managed to recover its cost with the virtue of being released in three languages. Raj Nartaki established J. B. H Wadia's reputation as an intellectual film maker. The story is set in the early 19th century in the Manipur Kingdom and is about social barriers and a court dancer.
summary: Raj Nartaki was made simultaneously in English, Bengali, and Hindi. This multilingual approach allowed the film to reach a wider audience, making it accessible to diverse linguistic groups. The film was distributed in Europe and the US through Columbia in Hollywood, and its ability to be presented in three languages was advantageous in recovering its production costs, as it attracted viewers from various regions.

The Moscow Province (Russian:  ) was a province of Moscow Governorate of the Russian Empire, which existed 17191775. Its center was the city of Moscow.
Moscow province was formed as part of the Moscow gubernya by decree of Peter the Great in 1719. The cities of Moscow, Borisovo, Borovsk, Vereya, Volokolamsk, Dmitrov, Zvenigorod, Kashira, Klin, Kolomna, Maloyaroslavets, Mozhaysk, Ruza, Serpukhov with Obolensk and Tarusa counties were included in the province.
In November 1775, the division of gubernyas into provinces was abolished.


== References ==
summary: The Moscow Province included several cities, among which are Moscow, Borisovo, Borovsk, Vereya, and Volokolamsk. The significance of having Moscow as its center lies in its status as the capital city and its cultural, economic, and political importance in the region. As a historic heart of Russia, Moscow served not only as a central administrative hub for the province but also as a crucial center for trade, education, and the arts, influencing the development of the surrounding areas.

The 2007 Al Fatih Cup Final was played on July 15, 2007 between Al Akhdar and Al Ittihad. This was Al Ittihad's 9th final, of which they had won four and lost 5, and Al Akhdar's 3rd. The game was a repeat of the 2005 final, when Al Ittihad comfortably won 3-0. Both sides had performed well in the league, Al Ittihad winning the title, and Al Akhdar coming 4th. Al Akhdar were guaranteed a place in the 2008 CAF Confederation Cup, as Al Ittihad had already qualified for the African Champions League as a result of winning the title. The game was close, but Al Ittihad won 1-0, thanks to a 53rd-minute goal from Burkinab striker Pierre Koulibaly.


== Match details ==
summary: The two teams that played in the 2007 Al Fatih Cup Final were Al Akhdar and Al Ittihad.

body: The following is a list of characters from The Walking Dead television series based on the eponymous comic book series. Although some characters appear in both the television and comic series, the continuity of the television series is not shared with the original comic book series.
summary: The television series The Walking Dead follows a different narrative path than its comic book counterpart. While the comic books were written by Robert Kirkman until their final issue in 2019, the television series has its own distinct storylines, following its own continuity. In the comics, The Walking Dead is not a simple question of good or bad characters; rather, the characters are a product of a changing environment they struggle to survive in. In contrast, the television series maintains a focus on the characters' struggles and emotional journeys. Additionally, there are differences between the two in terms of plot and characterization, reflecting the different mediums and creative processes of each.
